lines.text: Circumstances have taught me that a man's ethics are the only possessions he will take beyond the grave.
I'm not going to fear any man of flesh and blood, no matter what costume he wears.
Hope comes to the young as naturally as the spring rains.
I kept kissing frogs looking for a prince.
Life's terrible short girl. Give yourself some pleasure. I'll bet you've never been kissed.
Great money does not a great human make.
I always thought I had to be rich to own the stars.
We experienced a delirious, timeless peace.
I found my creation in you. It's life. God is love, Moll. Love is God.
Um, for your understanding, Flora, this is rather... delicate. Do you know what the male and female were intending?
Sure! I seen dogs in the street doing it!
Yes... well, it's not quite the same thing.
How do you know? You're not a dog!
Don't you understand? I'm going to fail you.
I can accept that.
No, *feel that!*
[hits him on his chest]
That's nothing compared to the pain that comes with me. "They hung her mother!" *Feel that!*
[she continues to hit him and begins to cry]
"She slept with *hundreds* of men!", *Feel it!*, "She's a bitch and a trollop" and I hate you!
[picks up her things and heads for the door]
This is madness.
[walks out the door]

[storms Back In]
I forgot me bleedin', stupid shoes!
[while Posing for the nude pregnant portrait]
It's moving!
Keep still... Both of you.
There are more compelling motives than fear.
Escaped from Cardiff prison hulks I did, with a highway alchemist named Gay; he could turn the lead in his pistols to gold

The Mad hermit that I am lived a wild life as a child. I made wings from canvas and bamboo. I wished to navigate the atmosphere like a bird; instead I studied gravity, and plunged forty feet from the mill roof.

[after his own long soliloquy, philosophizing on the answer to the ultimate question of life, the universe, & everything]
What do you want from life, Moll?
Nothin' anymore
Come on Moll; I bare my soul
[interrupted by Moll]

[interrupting the Artist]
and I bare my bosoms. We make a good pair

[after the Artist has challenged a threat from Mrs Allworthy's pistol]
Was that gun that useless?
I lied
[. clears throat . ]
rather well, I thought

[Moll has cleaned up the Artist's loft. Artist enters... ]
Well?
[points at his feet]
Take your boots off
You have yours on.
I haven't been outdoors
This is VERy unimportant.
. you angry 'cause I cleaned for you?
DON'T do this again! I'll never FIND anything.

[Moll grabs a shelving unit and throws it & contents to the floor, then repeats]
There! Back where it was.
[Moll crosses her arms & turns her back]
... GOD that felt good!

[Ruffian shoves Hibble as they pass each other]
Oy blackie, go' any news from the devil?

[Hibble decks him, hurting his hand]
Sent you that. How'd you like it?
